title: "Can You Survive the Deadly Bamboo Trail in Meghalaya ? "
description:
The Bamboo Trail is a treacherous path in Meghalaya, India, that is said to be deadly. The trail is made up of narrow bamboo bridges that are suspended high above the ground. The bridges are often slippery and unstable, and there have been many accidents on the trail.
In this video, I hike the Bamboo Trail to see if it is really as deadly as it is said to be. I will share my experience of hiking the trail, and I will also give you some tips on how to survive if you decide to hike it yourself.

title: Chandratal Lake - The World's Most Beautiful Lake - Spiti Valley, Himachal Pradesh  | EP04
description:
CHANDRATAL LAKE : A DREAM FROM OPEN EYES | SPITI VALLEY  TRAVEL VIDEO EPISODE 04 | HIMACHAL PRADESH

Hi everyone.


Hope you are doing fine. I am so happy to present to you, the last episode of Spiti Travel Series which will take you to Chandrataal - The most divine and pristine lake of Spiti Valley.
Please watch previous 3 episodes of Spiti Travel Series if you have not watched them before and then watch this last episode.

 

Chandra Taal means the Lake of the Moon. The name of the lake originates from its crescent shape. It is situated at an altitude of about 4,300 metres (14,100 ft) in the Himalayas. The lake is accessible on foot from Batal as well as from Kunzum Pass from late May to early October.

 

As I was already in Spiti, I booked a cab from Kaza Taxi Union and left for Chandrataal in the morning at around 8 am. I was accompanied by my friends. We reached Chandrataal at around 2 pm. We booked our tents at Samsong Camps took rest for a while and then headed over for a 4kms trek to Chandrataal lake.

 

Watch full episode to see the awestruck travel journey which takes you to the unbelievable beautiful landscapes.



I will make a separate travel guide on how to reach Spiti and the favorable time to visit Spiti.

title: AULI UTTARAKHAND 2018 VLOG | HOW TO REACH AULI | AULI DRONE  | AULI TRAVEL GUIDE
description:
AULI UTTARAKHAND | How To Reach Auli | AULI DRONE VIDEO | TRAVEL GUIDE 

Presenting to you all - Auli -The winter wonderland of Uttarakhand.
Situated at a height of 3049m, this place is no less than a winter dream. 
In this long weekend, I travelled to Auli with my friends. We were a group of 6.

Ours was a spontaneous plan and we travelled to Auli in an Ola Outstation which was the best cheapest option that we explored and moreover we were lucky to have the coolest cab driver.
We travelled in the entire night and reached Auli in the morning.

This place is best if you want to have a real experience of snow that is stretched in the entire visible land. 


You can do camping and bonfire, skiing, snow hiking, fulfill your snow fantasies and experience the cable car rides.
Auli is Surrounded by mountains on all sides.

We did camping and in the morning, went to see the artificial lake that is made in the Auli Ski Point.
We did a hike of around 1.5 kms to reach there and the 360 degrees view from atop is worth watching.


So, make your plans to Auli while it‚Äôs still winter and experience the chill of snow.
Get the real winter vibes in the Himalayas.

title: Manali to Spiti Valley by Road  | Drone Shots ~ Traveling Mondays
description:
Spiti is still a dream for many. But we managed to live this dream. 

Here it is first travel vlog in the Spiti series.

We started our journey from Delhi in the evening, boarded a Volvo from Majnu ka Tilla. It was 15 hours long comfortable journey. Next morning, when we opened our eyes, we had reached Mandi and we were really excited to find ourselves in the fresh mountain air. We reached Manali bus stand at around 11 am.

We thought of chilling at the bus stand first, as we had found a water stream running at the back side of the bus stand known locally as khadd. I could not control myself and jumped into the water with my go pro. 

After almost 2 hours, we hired a cab from bus stand and went to mall road, where we had booked our hotel.
Then, we ahead to old Manali, the most happening place of Manali. Explored markets and some Cafes, which Old Manali is famous for.

Next morning at 7 am, we left for Spiti in a traveler. The road from Manali till Spiti is full of surprises. From vegetation to landscape everything kept on changing. 

We stopped at the famous Chacha-Chachi Chandra Dhaba for lunch at Batal. Our next stoppage was Kunzum pass. There is a temple called Kunzum Devi Temple where everyone stops to seek the blessings of Kunzum Devi. By 6 in the evening we reached Kaza.

It was already dark. We strolled around in the streets of Kaza and then dozed off 

This was episode 1. Stay tuned for the 2nd episode of Spiti- Magical Exploration which will be  about Kaza, Ki and Kibber.
